alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:17AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kanawha, northwestern Fayette and northeastern Boone Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 317 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Van, or 8 miles southeast of Madison, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madison, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Belle, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Pratt, Van, Burnwell, Powellton, Whitesville, Handley, Sylvester, Seth, Leewood, Dawes, Prenter and Sharon. This includes West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 65 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
